Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the success of the hospitals by stating that two-thirds of the top-rated hospitals in Florida were their hospitals.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide any evidence or data to support the statement that two-thirds of the top-rated hospitals in Florida were their hospitals.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that being the top-rated hospitals in Florida automatically means they had the best care at the lowest prices for their patients, without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for why their hospitals were top-rated in Florida, such as marketing strategies or other factors not mentioned in the claim.
